history.content:
Physiologic Informatics Research Internship at Dascena: Students and Recent Grads

 

Join a team of physicians and engineers developing clinical decision support tools to reduce preventable deaths caused by sepsis and patient discharge errors. This NIH funded project involves predictive analysis of EHR (electronic health record) data through machine learning. Students interested in research in preparation for medical or graduate school, or students who are interested in gaining exposure to the biotech/startup world, are encouraged to apply for Summer 2019. We also have full-time opportunities, effective immediately, for recent graduates.

 

We have physiologic research, statistical algorithm development, programming, and peer-review manuscript writing opportunities available. Students must be able to make a substantial commitment (40 hours/week) to this position during the summer. Recent graduates must be able to work full-time for a minimum of a year.

 

If this sounds interesting, apply here (this takes less than 10 minutes!): https://phys-inf.typeform.com/to/A470d6. We will be accepting applications until the positions are filled, so apply early!

 

For further information, please email Samson Mataraso (samson@dascena.com).
history.subject: Summer Internship Opportunity
